strings.Value: "I couldn't find you anywhere."
"Can I join you?"
"What the devil are you doing, relaxing here? Get back to your post, immediately!"
"It's still strange to see you here, with wine in your hand."
"I don't like sitting in silence. Tell me, how have you been?"
[Drink your beer silently]
"Do you regret what happened by the trading post?"
"Your scar still hasn't healed."
"I just want to be sure I can still count on you."
"Don't speak to me in that tone."
"You're behaving differently than I'm used to."
"Yes."
"No."
"For me, you're always beautiful. Nothing could ever change that."
"I don't value you for your beauty."
"I like you as a friend and as a companion."
"Because of the scar?"
"One might drink herself into a grave like that..."
[Keep quiet]

{n}Soon after returning to the city, you realize Valerie is not at her usual post. Asking a series of servants and guards, you find your way to the city tavern, where you find the girl with a glass of wine.{/n}
"{name}?" {n}Valerie looks up at you, surprised, and seems to blush a little.{/n} "Do you need something?"

{n}A smile touches Valerie's lips.{/n} "Truth be told, that was the plan. Sometimes I need... to be alone." {n}Valerie pauses, then continues.{/n} "But I don't mind drinking with you. Since you found me."
{n}Valerie's eyes turn into slits, and she reluctantly puts away her glass.{/n} "As you wish, Your Grace."
{n}Valerie scoots over, giving you some space. You take an empty stool and order a drink. For a few minutes there's a tense silence between you. The girl slowly sips her drink.{/n}

"Like a mere mortal — is that what you mean?" {n}Valerie scoffs and sips from the glass.{/n} "Few would imagine it, but I have rough days too. Days when I prefer to hide from prying looks and just be alone."

{n}You slowly drink shoulder to shoulder with Valerie. At last she sighs and starts talking.{/n} "Since you and I met Fredero, I've started coming here more often. I don't care but..." {n}Valerie stops but then sighs and continues.{/n} "I don't care, but I'm getting tired of all the extra attention that's being so generously shoveled at me."
{n}Valerie gives you a thin smile, running her finger along the rim of the glass.{/n} "Unusual. But I'll get used to it."
{n}The awkward half-smile on Valerie's face turns into an angry sneer.{/n} "So? Does it change anything? Did my sword arm fall off? Or all my fencing knowledge, did it fell out of my head?"
{n}Valerie scoffs, studying the contents of her glass.{/n} "Fredero got what he wanted — a duel. And then he left us alone. — Isn't that what we wanted?"

"Oh no, our beautiful Valerie has stopped being such a beauty! Her wonderful face is ruined. It must mean there's something wrong with her!" {n}Valerie slams her hand on the table fiercely.{/n} "I have to say, I want to scream at everyone who keeps looking at me with terror and regret: where has your adoration and veneration gone? Vanished with one swing of a sword?"
{n}Valerie turns around and looks right at you.{/n} "And what is that supposed to mean, {name}?"
{n}Valerie scoffs.{/n} "Just like everybody else, you're used to seeing what I prefer to show to the world. Anyway, I think I know exactly what you mean. The most obvious thing."
{n}Valerie finishes her glass in one gulp and slams it on the counter.{/n} "My apologies, Your Grace. I was out of line." {n}The girl stands up and walks out of the tavern.{/n}

{n}Flushing red, Valerie turns to you and with an almost daring sneer.{/n} "It would be strange to expect anything else from you. — You, just like the rest of my admirers, now consider me... how should I put it... damaged goods! Well, where are your compliments now? Do you like this Valerie?"
"What?" {n}Valerie stops. Blinking a few times, she stares in your face, as if trying to find signs of deceit.{/n} "But..."
{n}Valerie winces for a moment, and then laughs, relieved.{/n} "Your honesty is like a breath of fresh air, {name}. Another woman would slap you, but I thank you for your honesty."

{n}Valerie pauses, and then stands up.{/n} "I think I've had enough for today — both wine and honesty. Please, don't worry about my ability to serve you. I vowed to fight shoulder to shoulder with you, and I'll not break it."

{n}Valerie bites her lip and looks down. It's the first time you've see her respond like this to a compliment. At last she looks away and answers softly.{/n} "Empty flattery, no doubt. But thank you anyway."
{n}Valerie looks away with a sad smile.{/n} "Really? Well, thank you for your words."
{n}Valerie freezes — then sighs in relief and laughs.{/n} "Of course! Forgive my hot temper — I don't know why I got so wound up. I value our friendship as well!"
"Of course! As if these... these fools pay attention to anything else!"
"One just might, and maybe it's for the better! No one's going to notice anyway — because of this!" {n}Valerie points at the scar on her face.{/n}
{n}Valerie stops, apparently sunk in her thoughts. Then she turns away, embarrassed.{/n} "Forgive me. Don't worry — you're not my nanny. I'll take care of my own problems."
{n}Valerie scoffs, studying the contents of her glass.{/n} "Fredero got what he wanted — a duel. I have nothing to regret."
